intro: Hieracium wiesbaurianum subsp. semiwiesbaurianum, commonly known as the semi-wiesbaurian hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. This subspecies is native to central and eastern Europe, typically found in grassy habitats and open woodlands. It grows to a height of about 20–40 cm and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant is perennial and has a creeping growth habit, often forming dense colonies in its native range.
